subject: Essential Eight Explained
document(english): 1  Introduction  The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) has developed prioritised mitigation strategies, in the form of the  Strategies to Mitigate Cyber Security Incidents , to help organisations protect themselves against various cyber  threats. The most effective of these mitigation strategies are the Essential Eight.  The Essential Eight has been designed to protect Microsoft Windows-based internet-connected networks. While the  principles behind the Essential Eight may be applied to cloud services and enterprise mobility, or other operating  systems, it was not primarily designed for such purposes and alternative mitigation strategies may be more appropriate  to mitigate unique cyber threats to these environments.  The Essential Eight  The mitigation strategies that constitute the Essential Eight are:   application control   patch applications   configure Microsoft Office macro settings   user application hardening   restrict administrative privileges   patch operating systems   multi-factor authentication   regular backups.  Implementing the Essential Eight  The Essential Eight Maturity Model articulates requirements for the implementation of the Essential Eight.  Assessing implementations of the Essential Eight  Assessments against the Essential Eight should be conducted using the Essential Eight Assessment Process Guide.
